page.title: 05MOTORWAY (M66)
page.content:
The motorway has been cut through a hilly area. It has passed through many of the irregular fields in the area. Many farmers have been paid compensation for loss of grazing land.
The motorway passes close to a new industrial estate. One of the companies (Tetrosyl who make car underseal) had to relocate to this estate with a temporary loss of 350 jobs.
The M66 joins onto the trans- Pennine M62 and enables many cars and lorries to by-pass the town of Bury. It has also helped the area to become a commuter area for North Manchester, bringing some much needed prosperity to the area.
